page.title: 07Interview with a Resident
page.content: Mr Waldock was born in 1904.He went to school on his third birthday.He thinks schools gave children a better education then.If children did some- thing wrong they were caned on the hand. In 1917,when he was 13,Mr Waldock left school.He still has his labour certificate, which he was given then. At that time Royston was much smaller with no housing estates and more fields. Mr Waldock went to work for a farmer. He started work at 5am and finished at 6pm.He worked every day of the year and earned two shillings a week wages. During the second World War he was a Home Guard. He has never owned a car,but he rode a bike and a motorbike His best memory is of Royston Fair, his worst when he was run over in the High Street and his thumb was squashed
